headline.print_headline: Campaign for Staten Island District Attorney Goes From Quiet to Contentious
headline.main: Race for Staten Island District Attorney Goes From Quiet to Contentious

snippet: Republican leaders had all but conceded the fight to Michael E. McMahon, a Democrat who once served in Congress, before Joan Illuzzi, a career prosecutor, abruptly entered the contest.
abstract: Contest for new Staten Island district attorney has turned from foregone conclusion to contentious race between Democrat Michael E McMahon and Republican Joan Illuzzi, who unexpectedly entered race after Republicans' preferred candidate declined to run.
lead_paragraph: Republican leaders had all but conceded the fight to Michael E. McMahon, a Democrat who once served in Congress, before Joan Illuzzi, a career prosecutor, abruptly entered the contest.
